result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcos V Alvarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Upon successful completion of conditions of probation, probation may be terminated early.

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment. Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Write a letter of apology to Officer Thomas Slowinski - MPD.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marcos V Alvarez in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a final pre-trial.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.
Jury trial date of 11/9/15 was ordered vacated. Case adjourned in branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcos V Alvarez in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing today.  Defense requested an adjournment.  Court ordered case set for final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcos V Alvarez in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. Court ordered no possession or use of no dangerous weapons or firearms.   No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Marcos V Alvarez in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 
 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
